description.narrative: By supporting the expansion of this strong vehicle and equipment leasing, long-term rental, and consumer finance company into new markets such as the Tanzania and Kenya, IFC will improve access to financing for SMEs and job-producing companies in both countries. Participating in this expansion will enable IFC to add value to the project, based on its presence in the new markets, and its leasing experience in advisory services, legislative advisory services, and financial services in the region. The project is expected to have a strong development impact in the following areas: i.) Enhance Alios Finances ability to deepen access to financial services for SMEs in Kenya and Tanzania; ii.) Increase Alios Finances access to local currency financing; and; iii.) Subject to diagnostic work, strengthen the business environment for leasing in the region.

The project seeks to deepen and broaden financial services for small and medium enterprise (SME) in sub-Saharan Africa by supporting the expansion of Alios Finance, S.A. (Alios Finance), a leasing, equipment rental, investment lending, and consumer finance group whose founders have over 50 years of experience in asset finance in the region. The project aims to support the expansion of Alios Finance into East Africa by providing a financing package of up to $10.2 million in combined senior debt and equity to its greenfield leasing subsidiaries in Tanzania and Kenya, and a proposed advisory services package to strengthen Alios Finances operations as well as the business environment for leasing in the region. To date, SMEs in sub-Saharan Africa have significant unmet demand for term financing for equipment and other assets. The project proposes to support a seasoned leasing group that would be well positioned to respond to the demand for asset finance in the region.
